column2: Self-motivated and self-oriented. A drive to map out a personal life and follow a unique path. Difficulties arise when others obstruct this path. Independence and solitude are valued. The company of others is enjoyable, provided there is freedom for personal pursuits. A tendency toward egocentric and selfish behavior.

Identity and personal resources form the basis for all success. A need for inner security before engaging with the wider world. Family roots and the home environment provide the foundation for self-discovery, self-knowledge, and future success. A risk of becoming reclusive or overly focused on the private sphere.

Interactions with others play a paramount role. Both personal relationships and broader social dynamics are valued. A gift for mediation, stemming from an insight into the nuances of relationships. Self-discovery occurs primarily through relationships. A vulnerability to being engulfed in stifling relationships.

Public life is of pinnacle importance. Personal satisfaction and self-knowledge are gained from worldly achievements and public standing. A need for a high public profile, met through career and social status. A potential for public achievements to come at the expense of personal relationships.
